citations.narrative:
In December 2024, the facility acquired and transported thirteen adult West Highland White Terriers from another state to
their facility without the issuance of health certificates by a licensed veterinarian. During the inspection, the licensee
confirmed the newly acquired Terriers were purchased with the intent to breed at the facility. Health certificates are
important for ensuring that animals are healthy, suitable for travel, and free from signs of disease. Dealers who transport
dogs in commerce shall have a health certificate executed and issued by a licensed veterinarian within 10 days of travel
to accompany the animals.
Correct by January 31, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.78(a) 
   
Health certification and identification. 
In December 2024, the facility acquired and transported thirteen adult West Highland White Terriers from another state to 
their facility without the issuance of health certificates by a licensed veterinarian. During the inspection, the licensee 
confirmed the newly acquired Terriers were purchased with the intent to breed at the facility. Health certificates are 
important for ensuring that animals are healthy, suitable for travel, and free from signs of disease. Dealers who transport 
dogs in commerce shall have a health certificate executed and issued by a licensed veterinarian within 10 days of travel 
to accompany the animals. 
 
Correct by January 31, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
